LiveAPI.Doc: Unofficial Live API documentation generated by the “API_MakeDoc” MIDI Remote Script.
This is unofficial documentation. Please do not contact Ableton with questions or problems relating to the use of this documentation.

Class.name: Application
Class.Doc: This class represents the Live application.

Class.name: View
Class.Doc: This class represents the view aspects of the Live application.

Method.name: available_main_views()
Method.Doc: Return a list of strings with the available subcomponent views, which is to be specified, when using the rest of this classes functions. A ‘subcomponent view’ is a main view component of a document view, like the Session view, the Arranger or Detailview and so on…

Property.name: browse_mode
Property.Doc: Return true if HotSwap mode is active for any target.

Method.name: add_browse_mode_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “browse_mode” has changed.

Method.name: browse_mode_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “browse_mode”.

Method.name: remove_browse_mode_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “browse_mode”.

Property.name: canonical_parent
Property.Doc: Get the canonical parent of the application view.

Method.name: focus_view()
Method.Doc: Show and focus one through the identifier string specified view.

Property.name: focused_document_view
Property.Doc: Return the name of the document view (‘Session’ or ‘Arranger’)shown in the currently selected window.

Method.name: add_focused_document_view_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “focused_document_view” has changed.

Method.name: focused_document_view_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “focused_document_view”.

Method.name: remove_focused_document_view_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “focused_document_view”.

Method.name: hide_view()
Method.Doc: Hide one through the identifier string specified view.

Method.name: is_view_visible()
Method.Doc: Return true if the through the identifier string specified view is currently visible. If main_window_only is set to False, this will also check in second window. Notifications from the second window are not yet supported.

Method.name: add_is_view_visible_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “is_view_visible” has changed.

Method.name: is_view_visible_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “is_view_visible”.

Method.name: remove_is_view_visible_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “is_view_visible”.

Method.name: scroll_view()
Method.Doc: Scroll through the identifier string specified view into the given direction, if possible. Will silently return if the specified view can not perform the requested action.

Method.name: show_view()
Method.Doc: Show one through the identifier string specified view. Will throw a runtime error if this is called in Live’s initialization scope.

Method.name: toggle_browse()
Method.Doc: Reveals the device chain, the browser and starts hot swap for the selected device. Calling this function again stops hot swap.

Method.name: add_view_focus_changed_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “view_focus_changed” has changed.

Method.name: remove_view_focus_changed_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “view_focus_changed”.

Method.name: view_focus_changed_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “view_focus_changed”.

Method.name: zoom_view()
Method.Doc: Zoom through the identifier string specified view into the given direction, if possible. Will silently return if the specified view can not perform the requested action.

Property.name: browser
Property.Doc: Returns an interface to the browser.

Property.name: canonical_parent
Property.Doc: Returns the canonical parent of the application.

Property.name: control_surfaces
Property.Doc: Const access to a list of the control surfaces selected in preferences, in the same order.The list contains None if no control surface is active at that index.

Method.name: add_control_surfaces_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “control_surfaces” has changed.

Method.name: control_surfaces_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “control_surfaces”.

Method.name: remove_control_surfaces_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “control_surfaces”.

Property.name: current_dialog_button_count
Property.Doc: Number of buttons on the current dialog.

Property.name: current_dialog_message
Property.Doc: Text of the last dialog that appeared; Empty if all dialogs just disappeared.

Method.name: get_bugfix_version()
Method.Doc: Returns an integer representing the bugfix version of Live.

Method.name: get_major_version()
Method.Doc: Returns an integer representing the major version of Live.

Method.name: get_minor_version()
Method.Doc: Returns an integer representing the minor version of Live.

Method.name: has_option()
Method.Doc: Returns True if the given entry exists in Options.txt, False otherwise.

Property.name: open_dialog_count
Property.Doc: The number of open dialogs in Live. 0 if not dialog is open.

Method.name: add_open_dialog_count_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “open_dialog_count” has changed.

Method.name: open_dialog_count_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “open_dialog_count”.

Method.name: remove_open_dialog_count_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “open_dialog_count”.

Method.name: press_current_dialog_button()
Method.Doc: Press a button, by index, on the current message box.

Property.name: unavailable_features
Property.Doc: List of features that are unavailable due to limitations of the current Live edition.

Method.name: add_unavailable_features_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “unavailable_features” has changed.

Method.name: remove_unavailable_features_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “unavailable_features”.

Method.name: unavailable_features_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “unavailable_features”.

Property.name: view
Property.Doc: Returns the applications view component.

Class.name: UnavailableFeatureVector
Class.Doc: A container for returning unavailable features.

Built-In.name: combine_apcs()
Built-In.Doc: Returns true if multiple APCs should be combined.

Built-In.name: encrypt_challenge()
Built-In.Doc: Returns an encrypted challenge based on the TEA algortithm

Built-In.name: encrypt_challenge2()
Built-In.Doc: Returns the UMAC hash for the given challenge.

Built-In.name: get_random_int()
Built-In.Doc: Returns a random integer from the given range.

Class.name: FloatVector
Class.Doc: A simple container for returning floats from Live.

Class.name: IntVector
Class.Doc: A simple container for returning integers from Live.

Class.name: ObjectVector
Class.Doc: A simple read only container for returning python objects.

Class.name: StringVector
Class.Doc: A simple container for returning strings from Live.

Class.name: Timer
Class.Doc: A timer that will trigger a callback after a certain inverval. The timer can be repeated and will trigger the callback every interval. Errors in the callback will stop the timer.

Class.name: Vector
Class.Doc: A simple read only container for returning objects from Live.

Class.name: Browser
Class.Doc: This class represents the live browser data base.

Property.name: audio_effects
Property.Doc: Returns a browser item with access to all the Audio Effects content.

Property.name: clips
Property.Doc: Returns a browser item with access to all the Clips content.

Property.name: colors
Property.Doc: Returns a list of browser items containing the configured colors.

Property.name: current_project
Property.Doc: Returns a browser item with access to all the Current Project content.

Property.name: drums
Property.Doc: Returns a browser item with access to all the Drums content.

Property.name: filter_type
Property.Doc: Bang triggered when the hotswap target has changed.

Method.name: add_filter_type_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “filter_type” has changed.

Method.name: filter_type_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “filter_type”.

Method.name: remove_filter_type_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “filter_type”.

Method.name: add_full_refresh_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “full_refresh” has changed.

Method.name: full_refresh_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “full_refresh”.

Method.name: remove_full_refresh_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “full_refresh”.

Property.name: hotswap_target
Property.Doc: Bang triggered when the hotswap target has changed.

Method.name: add_hotswap_target_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “hotswap_target” has changed.

Method.name: hotswap_target_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “hotswap_target”.

Method.name: remove_hotswap_target_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “hotswap_target”.

Property.name: instruments
Property.Doc: Returns a browser item with access to all the Instruments content.

Property.name: legacy_libraries
Property.Doc: Returns a list of browser items containing the installed legacy libraries. The list is always empty as legacy library handling has been removed.

Property.name: max_for_live
Property.Doc: Returns a browser item with access to all the Max For Live content.

Property.name: midi_effects
Property.Doc: Returns a browser item with access to all the Midi Effects content.

Property.name: packs
Property.Doc: Returns a browser item with access to all the Packs content.

Property.name: plugins
Property.Doc: Returns a browser item with access to all the Plugins content.

Method.name: relation_to_hotswap_target()
Method.Doc: Returns the relation between the given browser item and the current hotswap target

Property.name: samples
Property.Doc: Returns a browser item with access to all the Samples content.

Property.name: sounds
Property.Doc: Returns a browser item with access to all the Sounds content.

Property.name: user_folders
Property.Doc: Returns a list of browser items containing all the user folders.

Property.name: user_library
Property.Doc: Returns a browser item with access to all the User Library content.

Class.name: BrowserItem
Class.Doc: This class represents an item of the browser hierarchy.

Property.name: children
Property.Doc: Const access to the descendants of this browser item.

Property.name: is_device
Property.Doc: Indicates if the browser item represents a device.

Property.name: is_folder
Property.Doc: Indicates if the browser item represents folder.

Property.name: is_loadable
Property.Doc: True if item can be loaded via the Browser’s ‘load_item’ method.

Property.name: is_selected
Property.Doc: True if the item is ancestor of or the actual selection.

Property.name: iter_children
Property.Doc: Const iterable access to the descendants of this browser item.

Property.name: name
Property.Doc: Const access to the canonical display name of this browser item.

Property.name: source
Property.Doc: Specifies where does item come from — i.e. Live pack, user library…

Property.name: uri
Property.Doc: The uri describes a unique identifier for a browser item.

Class.name: BrowserItemIterator
Class.Doc: This class iterates over children of another BrowserItem.

Class.name: BrowserItemVector
Class.Doc: A container for returning browser items from Live.

Class.name: Chain
Class.Doc: This class represents a group device chain in Live.

Property.name: canonical_parent
Property.Doc: Get the canonical parent of the chain.

Property.name: color
Property.Doc: Access the color index of the Chain.

Method.name: add_color_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “color” has changed.

Method.name: color_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “color”.

Method.name: remove_color_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “color”.

Property.name: color_index
Property.Doc: Access the color index of the Chain.

Method.name: add_color_index_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “color_index” has changed.

Method.name: color_index_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “color_index”.

Method.name: remove_color_index_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “color_index”.

Method.name: delete_device()
Method.Doc: Remove a device identified by its index from the chain. Throws runtime error if bad index.

Property.name: devices
Property.Doc: Return const access to all available Devices that are present in the chains

Method.name: add_devices_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “devices” has changed.

Method.name: devices_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “devices”.

Method.name: remove_devices_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “devices”.

Property.name: has_audio_input
Property.Doc: return True, if this Chain can be feed with an Audio signal. This istrue for all Audio Chains.

Property.name: has_audio_output
Property.Doc: return True, if this Chain sends out an Audio signal. This istrue for all Audio Chains, and MIDI chains with an Instrument.

Property.name: has_midi_input
Property.Doc: return True, if this Chain can be feed with an Audio signal. This istrue for all MIDI Chains.

Property.name: has_midi_output
Property.Doc: return True, if this Chain sends out MIDI events. This istrue for all MIDI Chains with no Instruments.

Property.name: is_auto_colored
Property.Doc: Get/set access to the auto color flag of the Chain.If True, the Chain will always have the same color as the containingTrack or Chain.

Method.name: add_is_auto_colored_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “is_auto_colored” has changed.

Method.name: is_auto_colored_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “is_auto_colored”.

Method.name: remove_is_auto_colored_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “is_auto_colored”.

Property.name: mixer_device
Property.Doc: Return access to the mixer device that holds the chain’s mixer parameters:the Volume, Pan, and Sendamounts.

Property.name: mute
Property.Doc: Mute/unmute the chain.

Method.name: add_mute_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “mute” has changed.

Method.name: mute_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “mute”.

Method.name: remove_mute_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “mute”.

Property.name: muted_via_solo
Property.Doc: Return const access to whether this chain is muted due to some other chainbeing soloed.

Method.name: add_muted_via_solo_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “muted_via_solo” has changed.

Method.name: muted_via_solo_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “muted_via_solo”.

Method.name: remove_muted_via_solo_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “muted_via_solo”.

Property.name: name
Property.Doc: Read/write access to the name of the Chain, as visible in the track header.

Method.name: add_name_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “name” has changed.

Method.name: name_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “name”.

Method.name: remove_name_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “name”.

Property.name: solo
Property.Doc: Get/Set the solo status of the chain. Note that this will not disable thesolo state of any other Chain in the same rack. If you want exclusive solo, you have to disable the solo state of the other Chains manually.

Method.name: add_solo_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “solo” has changed.

Method.name: remove_solo_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “solo”.

Method.name: solo_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “solo”.

Class.name: AutomationEnvelope
Class.Doc: Describes parameter automation per clip.

Class.name: Clip
Class.Doc: This class represents a Clip in Live. It can be either an AudioClip or a MIDI Clip, in an Arrangement or the Session, dependingon the Track (Slot) it lives in.

Class.name: View
Class.Doc: Representing the view aspects of a Clip.

Property.name: canonical_parent
Property.Doc: Get the canonical parent of the clip view.

Property.name: grid_is_triplet
Property.Doc: Get/set wether the grid is showing in triplet mode.

Property.name: grid_quantization
Property.Doc: Get/set clip grid quantization resolution.

Method.name: select_envelope_parameter()
Method.Doc: Select the given device parameter in the envelope view.

Method.name: show_loop()
Method.Doc: Show the entire loop in the detail view.

Method.name: add_new_notes()
Method.Doc: Expects a Python iterable holding a number of Live.Clip.MidiNoteSpecification objects. The objects will be used to construct new notes in the clip.

Method.name: apply_note_modifications()
Method.Doc: Expects a list of notes as returned from get_notes_extended. The content of the list will be used to modify existing notes in the clip, based on matching note IDs. This function should be used when modifying existing notes, e.g. changing the velocity or start time. The function ensures that per-note events attached to the modified notes are preserved. This is NOT the case when replacing notes via a combination of remove_notes_extended and add_new_notes. The given list can be a subset of the notes in the clip, but it must not contain any notes that are not present in the clip.

Method.name: automation_envelope()
Method.Doc: Return the envelope for the given parameter.Returns None if the envelope doesn’t exist.Returns None for Arrangement clips.Returns None for parameters from a different track.

Property.name: available_warp_modes
Property.Doc: Available for AudioClips only.Get/Set the available warp modes, that can be used.

Method.name: beat_to_sample_time()
Method.Doc: Available for AudioClips only. Converts the given beat time to sample time. Raises an error if the sample is not warped.

Property.name: canonical_parent
Property.Doc: Get the canonical parent of the Clip.

Method.name: clear_all_envelopes()
Method.Doc: Clears all envelopes for this clip.

Method.name: clear_envelope()
Method.Doc: Clears the envelope of this clips given parameter.

Property.name: color
Property.Doc: Get/set access to the color of the Clip (RGB).

Method.name: add_color_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “color” has changed.

Method.name: color_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “color”.

Method.name: remove_color_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “color”.

Property.name: color_index
Property.Doc: Get/set access to the color index of the Clip.

Method.name: add_color_index_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “color_index” has changed.

Method.name: color_index_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “color_index”.

Method.name: remove_color_index_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “color_index”.

Method.name: create_automation_envelope()
Method.Doc: Creates an envelope for a given parameter and returns it.This should only be used if the envelope doesn’t exist.Raises an error if the envelope can’t be created.

Method.name: crop()
Method.Doc: Crops the clip. The region that is cropped depends on whether the clip is looped or not. If looped, the region outside of the loop is removed. If not looped, the region outside the start and end markers is removed.

Method.name: deselect_all_notes()
Method.Doc: De-selects all notes present in the clip.

Method.name: duplicate_loop()
Method.Doc: Make the loop two times longer and duplicates notes and envelopes. Duplicates the clip start/end range if the clip is not looped.

Method.name: duplicate_region()
Method.Doc: void duplicate_region(TPyHandle<AClip>, double, double, double [, int=-1 [, int=0]])

Duplicate the notes in the specified region to the destination_time. Only notes of the specified pitch are duplicated or all if pitch is -1. If the transposition_amount is not 0, the notes in the region will be transposed by the transpose_amount of semitones.Raises an error on audio clips.

Property.name: end_marker
Property.Doc: Get/Set the Clips end marker pos in beats/seconds (unit depends on warping).

Method.name: add_end_marker_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “end_marker” has changed.

Method.name: end_marker_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “end_marker”.

Method.name: remove_end_marker_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “end_marker”.

Property.name: end_time
Property.Doc: Get the clip’s end time.

Method.name: add_end_time_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “end_time” has changed.

Method.name: get_notes()
Method.Doc: boost::python::tuple get_notes(TPyHandle<AClip>, double, int, double, int)
Returns a tuple of tuples where each inner tuple represents a note starting in the given pitch- and time range. The inner tuple contains pitch, time, duration, velocity, and mute state.

Method.name: get_notes_by_id()
Method.Doc: Return a list of MIDI notes matching the given note IDs.

Method.name: get_notes_extended()
Method.Doc: std::__1::vector<NClipApi::TNoteInfo, std::__1::allocator<NClipApi::TNoteInfo> > get_notes_extended(TPyHandle<AClip>, int, int, double, double)

Returns a list of MIDI notes from the given pitch and time range. Each note is represented by a Live.Clip.MidiNote object. The returned list can be modified freely, but modifications will not be reflected in the MIDI clip until apply_note_modifications is called.

Method.name: get_selected_notes()
Method.Doc: Returns a tuple of tuples where each inner tuple represents a selected note. The inner tuple contains pitch, time, duration, velocity, and mute state.

Method.name: get_selected_notes_extended()
Method.Doc: Returns a list of all MIDI notes from the clip that are currently selected. Each note is represented by a Live.Clip.MidiNote object. The returned list can be modified freely, but modifications will not be reflected in the MIDI clip until apply_note_modifications is called.

Method.name: remove_notes_by_id()
Method.Doc: Delete all notes matching the given note IDs. This function should NOT be used to implement modification of existing notes (i.e. in combination with add_new_notes), as that leads to loss of per-note events. apply_note_modifications must be used instead for modifying existing notes.

Method.name: remove_notes_extended()
Method.Doc: void remove_notes_extended(TPyHandle<AClip>, int, int, double, double)

Delete all notes starting in the given pitch and time range. This function should NOT be used to implement modification of existing notes (i.e. in combination with add_new_notes), as that leads to loss of per-note events. apply_note_modifications must be used instead for modifying existing notes.

Method.name: replace_selected_notes()
Method.Doc: Called with a tuple of tuples where each inner tuple represents a note in the same format as returned by get_selected_notes. The notes described that way will then be used to replace the old selection.

Property.Doc: Available for AudioClips only.Get the sample length in sample time or -1 if there is no sample available.

Method.name: sample_to_beat_time()
Method.Doc: Available for AudioClips only. Converts the given sample time to beat time. Raises an error if the sample is not warped.

Method.name: scrub()
Method.Doc: Scrubs inside a clip. scrub_position defines the position in beats that the scrub will start from. The scrub will continue until stop_scrub is called. Global quantization applies to the scrub’s position and length.

Method.name: seconds_to_sample_time()
Method.Doc: Available for AudioClips only. Converts the given seconds to sample time. Raises an error if the sample is warped.

Method.name: set_fire_button_state()
Method.Doc: Set the clip’s fire button state directly. Supports all launch modes.

Method.name: set_notes()
Method.Doc: Called with a tuple of tuples where each inner tuple represents a note in the same format as returned by get_notes. The notes described that way will then be added to the clip.

Class.name: MidiNote

Method.name: create_clip()
Method.Doc: Creates an empty clip with the given length in the slot. Throws an error when called on non-empty slots or slots in non-MIDI tracks.

Method.name: delete_clip()
Method.Doc: Removes the clip contained in the slot. Raises an exception if the slot was empty.

Method.name: duplicate_clip_to()
Method.Doc: Duplicates the slot’s clip to the passed in target slot. Overrides the target’s clip if it’s not empty. Raises an exception if the (source) slot itself is empty, or if source and target have different track types (audio vs. MIDI). Also raises if the source or target slot is in a group track (so called group slot).

Method.name: fire()
Method.Doc: void fire(TPyHandle<AGroupAndClipSlotBase>)fire( (ClipSlot)self [, (float)record_length=1.7976931348623157e+308 [, (int)launch_quantization=-2147483648 [, (bool)force_legato=False]]]) → None : If ‘record_length’ is passed, the clip will be refired after the given recording length. Raises an error if the slot owns a clip. ‘launch_quantization’ determines the quantization of global transport that is applied overriding the value in the song. ‘force_legato’ will make the clip play inmediatelly. The playhead will be moved to keep the clip synchronized.
Fire a Clip if this Clipslot owns one, else trigger the stop button, if we have one.

Built-In.name: audio_to_midi_clip()
Built-In.Doc: Creates a MIDI clip in a new MIDI track with the notes extracted from the given audio_clip. The `audio_to_midi_type` decides which algorithm is used in the process. Raises error when called with an inconvertible clip or invalid `audio_to_midi_type`.

Built-In.name: create_drum_rack_from_audio_clip()
Built-In.Doc: Creates a new track with a drum rack with a simpler on the first pad with the specified audio clip.

Built-In.name: create_midi_track_from_drum_pad()
Built-In.Doc: Creates a new Midi track containing the specified Drum Pad’s device chain.

Built-In.name: create_midi_track_with_simpler()
Built-In.Doc: Creates a new Midi track with a simpler including the specified audio clip.

Built-In.name: is_convertible_to_midi()
Built-In.Doc: Returns whether `audio_clip` can be converted to MIDI. Raises error when called with a MIDI clip

Built-In.name: move_devices_on_track_to_new_drum_rack_pad()
Built-In.Doc: Moves the entire device chain of the track according to the track index onto the C1 (note 36) drum pad of a new drum rack in a new track.If the track associated with the track index does not contain any devices nothing changes (i.e. a new track and new drum rack are not created).

Built-In.name: sliced_simpler_to_drum_rack()
Built-In.Doc: Converts the Simpler into a Drum Rack, assigning each slice to a drum pad. Calling it on a non-sliced simpler raises an error.

Method.name: get_bank_count()
Method.Doc: Get the number of parameter banks. This is related to hardware control surfaces.

Method.name: get_bank_name()
Method.Doc: Get the name of a parameter bank given by index. This is related to hardware control surfaces.

Method.name: get_bank_parameters()
Method.Doc: Get the indices of parameters of the given bank index. Empty slots are marked as -1. Bank index -1 refers to the best-of bank. This function is related to hardware control surfaces.

Method.name: get_value_item_icons()
Method.Doc: Get a list of icon identifier strings for a list parameter’s values.An empty string is given where no icon should be displayed.An empty list is given when no icons should be displayed.This is related to hardware control surfaces.

Throws an exception when the source pad is empty, or when the source or destination indices are not between 0 - 127.

Class.name: DeviceParameter
Class.Doc: This class represents a (automatable) parameter within a MIDI orAudio DSP-Device.

Property.name: automation_state
Property.Doc: Returns state of type AutomationState.

Method.name: add_automation_state_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “automation_state” has changed.

Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “automation_state”.

Method.name: begin_gesture()
Method.Doc: Notify the begin of a modification of the parameter, when a sequence of modifications have to be consider a consistent group — for Sexample, when recording automation.

Property.name: canonical_parent
Property.Doc: Get the canonical parent of the device parameter.

Property.name: default_value
Property.Doc: Return the default value for this parameter. A Default value is onlyavailable for non-quantized parameter types (see ‘is_quantized’).

Method.name: end_gesture()
Method.Doc: Notify the end of a modification of the parameter. See begin_gesture.

Property.name: is_enabled
Property.Doc: Returns false if the parameter has been macro mapped or disabled by Max.

Property.name: is_quantized
Property.Doc: Returns True, if this value is a boolean or integer like switch.Non quantized values are continues float values.

Property.name: max
Property.Doc: Returns const access to the upper value of the allowed range forthis parameter

Property.name: min
Property.Doc: Returns const access to the lower value of the allowed range forthis parameter

Property.name: name
Property.Doc: Returns const access the name of this parameter, as visible in Livesautomation choosers.

Method.name: add_name_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “name” has changed.

Method.name: name_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “name”.

Method.name: remove_name_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “name”.

Property.name: original_name
Property.Doc: Returns const access the original name of this parameter, unaffected ofany renamings.

Property.name: state
Property.Doc: Returns the state of the parameter:- enabled - the parameter’s value can be changed, - irrelevant - the parameter is enabled, but value changes will not take any effect until it gets enabled, - disabled - the parameter’s value cannot be changed.

Method.name: add_state_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “state” has changed.

Method.name: remove_state_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “state”.

Method.name: state_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “state”.

Method.name: str_for_value()
Method.Doc: Return a string representation of the given value. To be used for display purposes only. This value can include characters like ‘db’ or ‘hz’, depending on the type of the parameter.

Property.name: value
Property.Doc: Get/Set the current value (as visible in the GUI) this parameter.The value must be inside the min/max properties of this device.

Method.name: add_value_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “value” has changed.

Method.name: remove_value_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “value”.

Method.name: value_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “value”.

Property.name: value_items
Property.Doc: Return the list of possible values for this parameter. Raises an error if ‘is_quantized’ is False.

Property.name: canonical_parent

Method.name: capture_and_insert_scene()
Method.Doc: Capture currently playing clips and insert them as a new scene after the selected scene. Raises a runtime error if creating a new scene would exceed the limitations.

Method.name: capture_midi()
Method.Doc: Capture recently played MIDI material from audible tracks. If no Destination is given or Destination is set to CaptureDestination.auto, the captured material is inserted into the Session or Arrangement depending on which is visible. If Destination is set to CaptureDestination.session or CaptureDestination.arrangement, inserts the material into Session or Arrangement, respectively. Raises a limitation error when capturing into the Session and a new scene would have to be created but can’t because it would exceed the limitations.

Property.name: clip_trigger_quantization
Property.Doc: Get/Set access to the quantization settings that are used to fireClips in the Session.

Method.name: continue_playing()
Method.Doc: Continue playing the song from the current position

Property.name: count_in_duration
Property.Doc: Get the count in duration. Returns an index, mapped as follows: 0 - None, 1 - 1 Bar, 2 - 2 Bars, 3 - 4 Bars.

Method.name: add_count_in_duration_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “count_in_duration” has changed.

Method.name: create_audio_track()
Method.Doc: Create a new audio track at the optional given index and return it.If the index is -1, the new track is added at the end. It will create a default audio track if possible. If the index is invalid or the new track would exceed the limitations, a limitation error is raised.If the index is missing, the track is created after the last selected item

Method.name: create_midi_track()
Method.Doc: Create a new midi track at the optional given index and return it.If the index is -1, the new track is added at the end.It will create a default midi track if possible. If the index is invalid or the new track would exceed the limitations, a limitation error is raised.If the index is missing, the track is created after the last selected item

Method.name: create_return_track()
Method.Doc: Create a new return track at the end and return it. If the new track would exceed the limitations, a limitation error is raised. If the maximum number of return tracks is exceeded, a RuntimeError is raised.

Method.name: create_scene()
Method.Doc: Create a new scene at the given index. If the index is -1, the new scene is added at the end. If the index is invalid or the new scene would exceed the limitations, a limitation error is raised.

Method.name: delete_track()
Method.Doc: Delete the track with the given index. If no track with this index exists, an exception will be raised.

Method.name: duplicate_scene()
Method.Doc: Duplicates a scene and selects the new one. Raises a limitation error if creating a new scene would exceed the limitations.

Method.name: duplicate_track()
Method.Doc: Duplicates a track and selects the new one. If the track is inside a folded group track, the group track is unfolded. Raises a limitation error if creating a new track would exceed the limitations.

Property.name: scale_name
Property.Doc: Set and access the last used scale name for control surfaces. The default scale names that can be saved with a set and recalled are'Major', ‘Minor’, ‘Dorian’, ‘Mixolydian’ , ‘Lydian’ , ‘Phrygian’ , ‘Locrian’, ‘Whole Tone’, ‘Half-whole Dim.’, ‘Whole-half Dim.’, ‘Minor Blues’, ‘Minor Pentatonic’, ‘Major Pentatonic’, ‘Harmonic Minor’, ‘Harmonic Major’, ‘Dorian #4’, ‘Phrygian Dominant’, ‘Melodic Minor’, ‘Lydian Augmented’, ‘Lydian Dominant’, ‘Super Locrian’, ‘Bhairav’, ‘Hungarian Minor’, ‘8-Tone Spanish’, ‘Hirajoshi’, ‘In-Sen’, ‘Iwato’, ‘Kumoi’, ‘Pelog Selisir’, ‘Pelog Tembung’, ‘Messaien 3’, ‘Messaien 4’, ‘Messaien 5’, ‘Messaien 6’, ‘Messaien 7’

Class.name: DeviceContainer

Class.name: RoutingChannel
Class.Doc: This class represents a routing channel.

Property.name: display_name

Property.name: layout
Property.Doc: The routing channel’s Layout, e.g., mono or stereo.

Class.name: RoutingChannelVector
Class.Doc: A container for returning routing channels from Live.

Class.name: RoutingType

Property.Doc: Category of the routing type.

Property.name: display_name
Property.Doc: Display name of routing type.

Class.name: RoutingTypeVector
Class.Doc: A container for returning routing types from Live.

Class.name: Track
Class.Doc: This class represents a track in Live. It can be either an Audio track, a MIDI Track, a Return Track or the Master track. The Master Track and at least one Audio or MIDI track will be always present.Return Tracks are optional.

Class.name: View
Class.Doc: Representing the view aspects of a Track.

Method.Doc: Duplicate a clip and put it into the next free slot and return the index of the destination slot. A new scene is created if no free slot is available. If creating the new scene would exceed the limitations, a runtime error is raised.

Method.name: duplicate_clip_to_arrangement()
Method.Doc: Duplicate the given clip into the arrangement of this track at the provided destination time and return it. When the type of the clip and the type of the track are incompatible, a runtime error is raised.

Property.Doc: const access to the index of the fired (and thus blinking) clipslot in this track.This index is -1 if no slot is fired and -2 if the track’s stop button has been fired.

Property.name: implicit_arm
Property.Doc: Arm the track for recording. When The track is implicitly armed, it showsin a weaker color in the live GUI and is not saved in the set.

Method.name: add_implicit_arm_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “implicit_arm” has changed.

Method.name: implicit_arm_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “implicit_arm”.

Method.name: remove_implicit_arm_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “implicit_arm”.

Property.Doc: Momentary value of left input channel meter, 0.0 to 1.0. For Audio Tracks only.

Property.Doc: Return the MIDI or Audio meter value of the Tracks input, depending on thetype of the Track input. Meter values (MIDI or Audio) are always scaledfrom 0.0 to 1.0.

Method.name: remove_input_meter_level_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “input_meter_level”.

Property.name: is_foldable
Property.Doc: return True if the track can be (un)folded to hide/reveal contained tracks.

Property.name: is_frozen
Property.Doc: return True if this Track is currently frozen. No changes should be applied to the track’s devices or clips while it is frozen.

Method.name: add_is_frozen_listener()
Method.Doc: Add a listener function or method, which will be called as soon as the property “is_frozen” has changed.

Method.name: is_frozen_has_listener()
Method.Doc: Returns true, if the given listener function or method is connected to the property “is_frozen”.

Method.name: remove_is_frozen_listener()
Method.Doc: Remove a previously set listener function or method from property “is_frozen”.

Property.name: is_grouped
Property.Doc: return True if this Track is current part of a group track.

Property.name: is_part_of_selection
Property.Doc: return False if the track is not selected.

Property.name: is_showing_chains
Property.Doc: Get/Set whether a track with a rack device is showing its chains in session view.

Method.name: add_is_showing_chains_listener()

Method.name: remove_is_showing_chains_listener()

Property.name: is_visible
Property.Doc: return False if the track is hidden within a folded group track.

Method.name: jump_in_running_session_clip()
Method.Doc: Jump forward or backward in the currently running Sessionclip (if any) by the specified relative amount in beats. Does nothing if no Session Clip is currently running.

Property.name: mixer_device
Property.Doc: Return access to the special Device that every Track has: This Device containsthe Volume, Pan, Sendamounts, and Crossfade assignment parameters.

Method.name: set_data()
Method.Doc: Store data for the given key in this object. The data is persistent and will be restored when loading the Live Set.

Property.name: solo
Property.Doc: Get/Set the solo status of the track. Note that this will not disable thesolo state of any other track. If you want exclusive solo, you have to disable the solo state of the other Tracks manually.

Method.name: stop_all_clips()
